description: Dashboard loads and displays all 6 key strategic indicators with current values
steps: Step 1: Navigate to the home page
Step 2: Verify US 10Y Treasury Yield is displayed with a numeric value
Step 3: Verify Fed Net Liquidity is displayed with a numeric value
Step 4: Verify Bitcoin Price is displayed with a numeric value
Step 5: Verify Stablecoin Market Cap is displayed with a numeric value
Step 6: Verify USDT Dominance is displayed with a numeric value
Step 7: Verify RWA TVL is displayed with a numeric value
Step 8: Confirm all metrics have proper units (%, $, etc.)
Step 9: Verify no loading errors or missing data placeholders
Step 10: Check that timestamp shows 'Last Updated' information

description: Week-over-Week (WoW) and 7-Day Change deltas are calculated and displayed correctly
steps: Step 1: Navigate to the dashboard
Step 2: Locate each metric card
Step 3: Verify each metric shows a delta/change indicator
Step 4: Confirm deltas are color-coded (green for positive, red for negative)
Step 5: Verify percentage or absolute change values are displayed
Step 6: Check that WoW calculation logic is correct based on historical data
Step 7: Verify 7-day change is properly calculated
Step 8: Confirm delta indicators use appropriate symbols (↑↓ or +/-)

description: Global Risk Status (Risk On/Risk Off) is automatically determined and displayed in header
steps: Step 1: Navigate to the dashboard
Step 2: Locate the header section
Step 3: Verify Global Risk Status indicator is visible
Step 4: Confirm status shows either 'Risk On' or 'Risk Off'
Step 5: Check that status is color-coded appropriately
Step 6: Verify logic correctly interprets Yield and Liquidity data
Step 7: Test with different data scenarios to confirm auto-determination works
Step 8: Ensure status updates when underlying data changes

description: Manual Refresh Button triggers data update workflow via GitHub Actions
steps: Step 1: Navigate to the dashboard header
Step 2: Locate the Manual Refresh button
Step 3: Click the Manual Refresh button
Step 4: Verify loading spinner appears immediately
Step 5: Confirm API call is made to Vercel Server Function
Step 6: Verify Server Function triggers GitHub Repository Dispatch
Step 7: Check that workflow_dispatch event is received by GitHub Actions
Step 8: Wait for workflow to complete (up to 60 seconds)
Step 9: Verify 'Update Started' toast notification appears
Step 10: Confirm dashboard data refreshes after workflow completion
Step 11: Verify 'Last Updated' timestamp is updated
Step 12: Check console for any errors during the refresh process

description: Smart Money Radar displays Top 5 Polymarket markets filtered by relevant tags
steps: Step 1: Navigate to the dashboard
Step 2: Locate the Smart Money Radar section (Column 1)
Step 3: Verify exactly 5 Polymarket events are displayed
Step 4: Confirm events are filtered by tags: Economics, Finance, Crypto, Federal Reserve
Step 5: Verify events are sorted by highest volume (liquidity) first
Step 6: Check each event shows: Title, Top Outcome %, Total Volume
Step 7: Verify outcome percentages are formatted correctly (e.g., 'Yes 82%')
Step 8: Confirm volume is displayed in dollar format
Step 9: Verify each market has a clickable link to Polymarket
Step 10: Test that link opens correct Polymarket page in new tab

description: Catalyst Calendar displays 4-week forward look with High/Medium impact US economic events
steps: Step 1: Navigate to the dashboard
Step 2: Locate the Catalyst Calendar section (Column 3)
Step 3: Verify events span exactly 4 weeks (current week + next 3)
Step 4: Confirm only US Economic events are shown
Step 5: Verify events are filtered to High/Medium impact only
Step 6: Check calendar is split into 'Completed' and 'Upcoming' sections
Step 7: For completed events, verify Actual vs Forecast is displayed
Step 8: Confirm surprise coloring (green/red based on deviation)
Step 9: For upcoming events, verify date, time, and forecast are shown
Step 10: Verify events are sorted chronologically
Step 11: Check that event impact level is clearly indicated
Step 12: Confirm calendar updates hourly based on workflow schedule

description: Data pipeline successfully fetches and stores metrics from FRED API
steps: Step 1: Trigger fetch_metrics.py workflow manually
Step 2: Verify FRED API is called for US 10Y Treasury Yield
Step 3: Verify FRED API is called for Fed Net Liquidity data
Step 4: Check that API responses are valid JSON
Step 5: Confirm data is parsed correctly
Step 6: Verify dashboard_data.json is updated with FRED metrics
Step 7: Check timestamp is updated in the JSON file
Step 8: Confirm proper error handling if FRED API fails
Step 9: Verify rate limiting is respected
Step 10: Test data validation to ensure no corrupt data is stored

description: Data pipeline successfully fetches crypto data from CoinGecko API
steps: Step 1: Trigger fetch_metrics.py workflow
Step 2: Verify CoinGecko API is called for Bitcoin price
Step 3: Check that market cap data is retrieved
Step 4: Confirm API response includes all required fields
Step 5: Verify data is correctly parsed and formatted
Step 6: Check that dashboard_data.json is updated with crypto metrics
Step 7: Verify historical data is stored for WoW calculations
Step 8: Confirm proper error handling for API failures
Step 9: Test that free tier rate limits are respected
Step 10: Verify fallback mechanism if CoinGecko is unavailable

description: Data pipeline successfully fetches DeFi data from DefiLlama API
steps: Step 1: Trigger fetch_metrics.py workflow
Step 2: Verify DefiLlama API is called for RWA TVL
Step 3: Verify DefiLlama API is called for Stablecoin data
Step 4: Check USDT dominance calculation is correct
Step 5: Confirm all required protocols/chains are included
Step 6: Verify data aggregation logic is working
Step 7: Check that dashboard_data.json is updated correctly
Step 8: Verify timestamp reflects latest update
Step 9: Test error handling for API failures
Step 10: Confirm data validation prevents corrupt entries

description: Data pipeline successfully fetches Top 5 Polymarket markets from Gamma API
steps: Step 1: Trigger fetch_metrics.py workflow
Step 2: Verify Polymarket Gamma API CLOB endpoint is called
Step 3: Confirm filtering by tags works correctly
Step 4: Verify sorting by volume (liquidity) is accurate
Step 5: Check that exactly top 5 markets are selected
Step 6: Verify each market includes: title, outcome, probability, volume, url
Step 7: Confirm probability calculations are correct
Step 8: Check that dashboard_data.json includes polymarket_top5 array
Step 9: Verify market URLs are properly formatted
Step 10: Test error handling if Polymarket API is unavailable

description: Calendar scraper successfully fetches events from Investing.com
steps: Step 1: Trigger fetch_calendar.py workflow
Step 2: Verify cloudscraper successfully bypasses Cloudflare protection
Step 3: Confirm Investing.com economic calendar page is accessed
Step 4: Verify 4-week window of events is scraped
Step 5: Check that event parsing extracts: id, name, date, time, forecast, actual, impact
Step 6: Verify only High/Medium impact events are included
Step 7: Confirm US-specific events are filtered correctly
Step 8: Check that calendar_data.json is created/updated
Step 9: Verify notification_states are initialized for each event
Step 10: Test error handling for scraping failures
Step 11: Verify retry logic if Investing.com blocks request
Step 12: Confirm data structure matches schema specification

description: Smart Diff logic correctly identifies significant metric changes
steps: Step 1: Load current user_config.json with defined thresholds
Step 2: Trigger fetch_metrics.py with new data
Step 3: Verify comparison with previous dashboard_data.json
Step 4: Test Bitcoin price change detection (threshold check)
Step 5: Test Stablecoin market cap change detection
Step 6: Test other metrics against their respective thresholds
Step 7: Verify changes below threshold do NOT trigger alerts
Step 8: Verify changes above threshold DO trigger alerts
Step 9: Check that multiple simultaneous changes are all detected
Step 10: Confirm alert payload includes metric name, old value, new value, delta

description: Telegram notification system broadcasts alerts to all subscribed chat IDs
steps: Step 1: Add multiple test Telegram chat IDs to user_config.json
Step 2: Trigger a metric change that exceeds threshold
Step 3: Verify broadcast_alert() function is called
Step 4: Confirm Telegram Bot API is called for each subscriber
Step 5: Verify message formatting is correct and readable
Step 6: Check that all chat IDs receive the notification
Step 7: Verify no subscribers are skipped in the loop
Step 8: Test error handling if one chat ID is invalid
Step 9: Confirm successful deliveries even if one fails
Step 10: Verify rate limiting is respected for Telegram API
Step 11: Check that notification includes metric details and timestamp
Step 12: Test with edge cases (empty subscriber list, single subscriber)

description: Email notification system sends alerts to all subscribed email addresses via SMTP
steps: Step 1: Add multiple test email addresses to user_config.json
Step 2: Configure SMTP secrets in GitHub (SMTP_HOST, SMTP_USER, SMTP_PASS)
Step 3: Trigger a metric change that exceeds threshold
Step 4: Verify broadcast_alert() function iterates through email subscribers
Step 5: Confirm SMTP connection is established
Step 6: Verify email is sent to each subscriber
Step 7: Check email subject line is descriptive
Step 8: Verify email body includes metric details
Step 9: Confirm HTML formatting is used for better readability
Step 10: Test error handling for invalid email addresses
Step 11: Verify successful sends even if one address fails
Step 12: Check that all emails are delivered within reasonable time

description: Calendar Pre-Event Warning alerts are sent 12 hours before high-impact events
steps: Step 1: Add upcoming high-impact event to calendar_data.json (13+ hours away)
Step 2: Wait for fetch_calendar.py hourly workflow to run
Step 3: Verify 12-hour warning window check is performed
Step 4: Confirm no alert is sent when >12 hours away
Step 5: Update system time or event time to be within 12-hour window
Step 6: Trigger fetch_calendar.py workflow
Step 7: Verify pre-event warning alert is generated
Step 8: Check that notification_states.sent_12h is set to true
Step 9: Confirm alert is broadcast to all subscribers (Telegram + Email)
Step 10: Verify alert message includes event name, time, and forecast
Step 11: Test that duplicate alerts are NOT sent (check sent_12h flag)
Step 12: Confirm only high-impact events trigger 12h warnings

description: Calendar Data Release alerts are sent immediately when actual data is published
steps: Step 1: Add upcoming event with no actual value to calendar_data.json
Step 2: Run fetch_calendar.py workflow (hourly check)
Step 3: Simulate data release by scraping actual value from Investing.com
Step 4: Verify actual vs forecast comparison is performed
Step 5: Confirm surprise calculation (deviation) is correct
Step 6: Verify Data Release alert is generated
Step 7: Check that notification_states.sent_release is set to true
Step 8: Confirm alert is broadcast to all subscribers
Step 9: Verify alert includes: event name, forecast, actual, surprise indicator
Step 10: Check that surprise is color-coded or highlighted
Step 11: Test that duplicate release alerts are NOT sent
Step 12: Verify alert timing (should be immediate within hourly check)

description: Polymarket odds flip alert triggers when probability swings >10%
steps: Step 1: Store initial Polymarket Top 5 data with baseline probabilities
Step 2: Trigger fetch_metrics.py workflow with updated Polymarket data
Step 3: Simulate >10% probability swing for one or more markets
Step 4: Verify odds flip detection logic identifies significant changes
Step 5: Confirm alert is generated for markets with >10% swing
Step 6: Check that markets with <10% swing do NOT trigger alerts
Step 7: Verify alert is broadcast to all subscribers
Step 8: Confirm alert message includes: market title, old probability, new probability
Step 9: Test with multiple simultaneous odds flips
Step 10: Verify proper handling of markets entering/exiting Top 5

description: Settings Modal allows users to add Telegram Chat IDs via UI
steps: Step 1: Navigate to the dashboard
Step 2: Click the Settings icon in the header
Step 3: Verify Settings Modal opens
Step 4: Locate the Subscriber Management section
Step 5: Find the 'Add Telegram Subscriber' form
Step 6: Enter a test Telegram Chat ID
Step 7: Enter a subscriber name
Step 8: Click 'Add Subscriber' button
Step 9: Verify form validation (reject invalid IDs)
Step 10: Confirm subscriber appears in the list
Step 11: Verify API call is made to update user_config.json
Step 12: Check that update_settings.yml workflow is triggered
Step 13: Confirm user_config.json is committed to repo with new subscriber
Step 14: Verify success notification is shown to user

description: Settings Modal allows users to add Email addresses via UI
steps: Step 1: Navigate to the dashboard
Step 2: Open the Settings Modal
Step 3: Locate the 'Add Email Subscriber' form
Step 4: Enter a valid email address
Step 5: Enter a subscriber name
Step 6: Click 'Add Subscriber' button
Step 7: Verify email format validation
Step 8: Confirm subscriber appears in the list
Step 9: Verify API call triggers update_settings.yml workflow
Step 10: Check that user_config.json is updated in repository
Step 11: Verify new email subscriber receives test notification
Step 12: Confirm success message is displayed

description: Settings Modal allows users to remove subscribers
steps: Step 1: Open Settings Modal with existing subscribers
Step 2: Locate the subscriber list
Step 3: Find the 'Remove' button next to a subscriber
Step 4: Click 'Remove' button
Step 5: Verify confirmation dialog appears
Step 6: Confirm removal
Step 7: Verify subscriber is removed from UI list
Step 8: Check that API call updates user_config.json
Step 9: Verify removed subscriber no longer receives alerts
Step 10: Confirm success notification is shown

description: Settings Modal threshold sliders adjust alert sensitivity
steps: Step 1: Open Settings Modal
Step 2: Locate the Threshold Sliders section
Step 3: Verify sliders exist for each metric (BTC, Stablecoin, etc.)
Step 4: Check current threshold values are displayed
Step 5: Adjust BTC threshold slider from 0.5% to 1.0%
Step 6: Verify live update of displayed value
Step 7: Click 'Save' button
Step 8: Confirm API call updates user_config.json
Step 9: Verify new thresholds are persisted in repository
Step 10: Test that alerts now use updated thresholds
Step 11: Verify changes with <1.0% don't trigger BTC alerts anymore
Step 12: Confirm success notification is displayed

description: Suggest Metric form submits GitHub Issue via API
steps: Step 1: Open Settings Modal
Step 2: Locate the 'Suggest Metric' section
Step 3: Enter a metric name in the form
Step 4: Enter a description/rationale
Step 5: Click 'Submit Suggestion' button
Step 6: Verify form validation (non-empty fields)
Step 7: Confirm API call to GitHub Issues API
Step 8: Verify issue is created in the repository
Step 9: Check issue title format is correct
Step 10: Verify issue body includes user-provided details
Step 11: Confirm issue is labeled appropriately (e.g., 'enhancement')
Step 12: Verify success message with issue link is shown to user

description: GitHub Actions workflow runs on schedule every 15 minutes for metrics
steps: Step 1: Check .github/workflows/fetch_metrics.yml configuration
Step 2: Verify cron schedule is set to */15 * * * *
Step 3: Wait for 15-minute interval to elapse
Step 4: Check GitHub Actions tab for workflow run
Step 5: Verify workflow executed automatically
Step 6: Confirm fetch_metrics.py script ran successfully
Step 7: Check that dashboard_data.json was updated
Step 8: Verify commit was pushed to repository
Step 9: Confirm timestamp reflects the scheduled run time
Step 10: Test that multiple consecutive runs occur at 15-min intervals

description: GitHub Actions workflow runs hourly for calendar updates
steps: Step 1: Check .github/workflows/fetch_calendar.yml configuration
Step 2: Verify cron schedule is set to 0 * * * *
Step 3: Wait for hourly interval
Step 4: Check GitHub Actions tab for workflow execution
Step 5: Verify fetch_calendar.py ran successfully
Step 6: Confirm calendar_data.json was updated
Step 7: Check that new events were scraped
Step 8: Verify notification logic was executed
Step 9: Confirm commit was pushed to repository
Step 10: Test multiple consecutive hourly runs

description: Update Settings workflow triggers via Repository Dispatch from UI
steps: Step 1: Make a settings change in the UI (add subscriber)
Step 2: Verify API route sends Repository Dispatch event
Step 3: Check GitHub Actions for update_settings.yml workflow
Step 4: Verify workflow receives JSON payload from UI
Step 5: Confirm payload includes correct subscriber/threshold data
Step 6: Verify workflow updates user_config.json
Step 7: Check that changes are committed to repository
Step 8: Verify commit message is descriptive
Step 9: Test that updated config is immediately available
Step 10: Confirm no race conditions with other workflows

description: Dashboard displays 'Last Updated' timestamp and updates correctly
steps: Step 1: Navigate to the dashboard
Step 2: Locate the 'Last Updated' indicator
Step 3: Verify timestamp is displayed in readable format
Step 4: Check that timestamp shows 'X mins ago' or similar
Step 5: Note the current timestamp
Step 6: Trigger a manual refresh
Step 7: Wait for data update to complete
Step 8: Verify timestamp updates to reflect new update time
Step 9: Confirm relative time updates dynamically (e.g., 1 min ago -> 2 mins ago)
Step 10: Test that timestamp never shows >15 minutes old under normal operation

description: Documentation Hub page (/docs) is accessible and comprehensive
steps: Step 1: Navigate to the dashboard
Step 2: Click the 'Docs' link in the header
Step 3: Verify /docs page loads successfully
Step 4: Check that page has clear navigation/sections
Step 5: Verify Indicator Encyclopedia section exists
Step 6: Confirm definitions for all 6 key metrics are present
Step 7: Check data source attribution for each metric
Step 8: Verify interpretation guides explain what values mean
Step 9: Confirm Operational Protocols section exists
Step 10: Check refresh policies are documented
Step 11: Verify notification rules are explained
Step 12: Confirm Setup Guide section exists
Step 13: Verify 'How to find Telegram Chat ID' instructions are clear
Step 14: Test that all links/references are functional

description: Documentation clearly explains the Risk On/Risk Off logic
steps: Step 1: Navigate to /docs page
Step 2: Find section on Risk Status determination
Step 3: Verify explanation of how Yields affect risk status
Step 4: Confirm explanation of how Liquidity affects risk status
Step 5: Check that threshold values are documented
Step 6: Verify examples are provided for different scenarios
Step 7: Confirm visual aids or diagrams are included if applicable

description: Error handling: Dashboard gracefully handles missing or stale data
steps: Step 1: Simulate missing dashboard_data.json file
Step 2: Navigate to the dashboard
Step 3: Verify appropriate error message or placeholder is shown
Step 4: Confirm page doesn't crash or show raw errors
Step 5: Restore dashboard_data.json with stale data (>15 mins old)
Step 6: Verify warning indicator shows data is stale
Step 7: Test that manual refresh can recover from stale data
Step 8: Simulate partial data (some metrics missing)
Step 9: Verify only affected metrics show errors
Step 10: Confirm other metrics display normally

description: Error handling: Notification system handles API failures gracefully
steps: Step 1: Trigger alert with invalid Telegram bot token
Step 2: Verify workflow doesn't crash
Step 3: Confirm error is logged appropriately
Step 4: Check that other subscribers still receive alerts
Step 5: Test with unreachable SMTP server
Step 6: Verify email failures don't block Telegram alerts
Step 7: Confirm retry logic for transient failures
Step 8: Test rate limiting scenarios
Step 9: Verify graceful degradation when one channel fails

description: Data validation: Pipeline rejects invalid or corrupted data
steps: Step 1: Simulate API returning malformed JSON
Step 2: Trigger fetch_metrics.py workflow
Step 3: Verify data validation catches the error
Step 4: Confirm corrupted data is NOT written to dashboard_data.json
Step 5: Check that previous valid data is preserved
Step 6: Verify error is logged with details
Step 7: Test with edge cases (null values, extreme numbers)
Step 8: Confirm validation rules for each metric type
Step 9: Test that out-of-range values are rejected
Step 10: Verify timestamp validation prevents future dates

description: Secrets management: All sensitive credentials are stored securely in GitHub Secrets
steps: Step 1: Check that TELEGRAM_BOT_TOKEN is in GitHub Secrets
Step 2: Verify SMTP_HOST is in GitHub Secrets
Step 3: Verify SMTP_USER is in GitHub Secrets
Step 4: Verify SMTP_PASS is in GitHub Secrets
Step 5: Confirm FRED API key (if required) is in Secrets
Step 6: Check that no secrets are hardcoded in repository
Step 7: Verify workflows properly reference secrets
Step 8: Test that secrets are not exposed in logs
Step 9: Confirm secrets are masked in GitHub Actions output
Step 10: Verify local .env files are gitignored

description: API rate limiting: All external APIs are called within free tier limits
steps: Step 1: Review FRED API usage and rate limits
Step 2: Verify fetch frequency doesn't exceed FRED limits
Step 3: Check CoinGecko free tier limits (50 calls/min)
Step 4: Confirm 15-minute fetch interval respects CoinGecko limits
Step 5: Review DefiLlama rate limits
Step 6: Verify Polymarket Gamma API usage is within limits
Step 7: Check Investing.com scraping frequency is respectful
Step 8: Test rate limiting logic in fetch_metrics.py
Step 9: Verify exponential backoff for retries
Step 10: Confirm no API key cost overruns occur

description: Mobile responsiveness: Bento Grid stacks properly on mobile devices
steps: Step 1: Open dashboard in mobile viewport (375px width)
Step 2: Verify 3-column layout changes to stacked single column
Step 3: Check that all metric cards are visible
Step 4: Confirm cards are properly sized for mobile
Step 5: Verify text is readable without horizontal scrolling
Step 6: Test touch interactions (taps, swipes)
Step 7: Check that Settings Modal works on mobile
Step 8: Verify Manual Refresh button is accessible
Step 9: Test Smart Money Radar on mobile
Step 10: Confirm Catalyst Calendar displays properly
Step 11: Verify hamburger menu or mobile navigation if applicable
Step 12: Test on multiple mobile screen sizes (iPhone, Android)

description: Vercel deployment: Next.js app deploys successfully to Vercel
steps: Step 1: Connect repository to Vercel
Step 2: Configure build settings (Next.js, App Router)
Step 3: Trigger deployment
Step 4: Verify build completes without errors
Step 5: Check that all pages are generated correctly
Step 6: Confirm dashboard_data.json is accessible from deployed app
Step 7: Test Vercel Serverless Functions work correctly
Step 8: Verify API routes are deployed
Step 9: Test Manual Refresh from production environment
Step 10: Confirm environment variables are set correctly
Step 11: Verify custom domain configuration (if applicable)
Step 12: Test that automatic deployments trigger on git push

description: Performance: Dashboard loads in under 2 seconds on first visit
steps: Step 1: Clear browser cache
Step 2: Navigate to dashboard URL
Step 3: Measure time to first contentful paint (FCP)
Step 4: Measure time to interactive (TTI)
Step 5: Verify FCP is under 1 second
Step 6: Verify TTI is under 2 seconds
Step 7: Check Lighthouse performance score (target >90)
Step 8: Test on fast 3G network simulation
Step 9: Verify no render-blocking resources
Step 10: Confirm images are optimized and lazy-loaded

description: Data freshness: Automatic updates ensure dashboard is never >15 minutes stale
steps: Step 1: Deploy application with scheduled workflows enabled
Step 2: Monitor dashboard over a 2-hour period
Step 3: Check 'Last Updated' timestamp every 5 minutes
Step 4: Verify at least one update occurs every 15 minutes
Step 5: Confirm GitHub Actions workflows execute on schedule
Step 6: Check that commits are pushed after each workflow
Step 7: Verify dashboard reflects updated data within 1 minute of commit
Step 8: Test during high-traffic and low-traffic periods
Step 9: Confirm no gaps or missed updates
Step 10: Verify alerting if data becomes stale (>15 mins)

description: Notification delivery: Telegram alerts arrive within 60 seconds of trigger
steps: Step 1: Add test Telegram chat ID to subscribers
Step 2: Manually trigger metric change exceeding threshold
Step 3: Start timer when change is detected
Step 4: Monitor Telegram for incoming alert
Step 5: Record time of alert arrival
Step 6: Verify alert arrives within 60 seconds
Step 7: Check alert content is accurate and formatted well
Step 8: Test with multiple simultaneous alerts
Step 9: Verify all alerts arrive within 60 seconds
Step 10: Confirm no duplicate alerts are sent

description: Notification delivery: Email alerts arrive within 2 minutes of trigger
steps: Step 1: Add test email to subscribers
Step 2: Configure SMTP settings correctly
Step 3: Trigger metric change exceeding threshold
Step 4: Start timer when change is detected
Step 5: Monitor email inbox
Step 6: Record time of email arrival
Step 7: Verify email arrives within 2 minutes
Step 8: Check email subject and body formatting
Step 9: Verify HTML rendering is correct
Step 10: Test with multiple simultaneous email alerts
Step 11: Confirm no emails are lost or delayed excessively

description: User configuration persistence: Settings changes are saved and persist across sessions
steps: Step 1: Open Settings Modal and add a new subscriber
Step 2: Close Settings Modal
Step 3: Refresh the page
Step 4: Reopen Settings Modal
Step 5: Verify new subscriber is still present
Step 6: Make threshold adjustment
Step 7: Close and refresh page
Step 8: Verify threshold persists
Step 9: Check user_config.json in repository
Step 10: Confirm all changes are committed
Step 11: Test from different browser/device
Step 12: Verify settings are consistent across all access points

description: Bitcoin metric card displays as large hero card in center column
steps: Step 1: Navigate to the dashboard
Step 2: Locate Column 2 (Market section)
Step 3: Verify Bitcoin Price card is prominently displayed
Step 4: Confirm card is larger than other metric cards
Step 5: Check that Bitcoin is visually emphasized (hero treatment)
Step 6: Verify current price is displayed in large font
Step 7: Confirm delta/change is clearly visible
Step 8: Check that card includes BTC icon or logo

description: All external links open in new tabs to preserve dashboard session
steps: Step 1: Navigate to Smart Money Radar section
Step 2: Click a Polymarket event link
Step 3: Verify link opens in new tab
Step 4: Confirm dashboard remains open in original tab
Step 5: Test documentation links
Step 6: Verify all external resources open in new tabs
Step 7: Check that internal navigation stays in same tab
Step 8: Test multiple link clicks don't create excessive tabs

description: Complete end-to-end workflow: User subscribes, receives alert, views updated dashboard
steps: Step 1: Navigate to the dashboard
Step 2: Open Settings Modal
Step 3: Add Telegram Chat ID as subscriber
Step 4: Save settings and close modal
Step 5: Verify user_config.json is updated in repository

description: Dashboard follows Bento Grid layout design with proper spacing and alignment

Step 4: Check consistent spacing between cards (16-24px)

Step 4: Check button includes refresh icon

Step 5: Verify UI elements are disabled during loading

description: Toast notifications are styled consistently and positioned correctly
steps: Step 1: Trigger a toast notification (e.g., refresh started)
Step 2: Verify toast appears in consistent position (top-right typically)

Step 4: Verify toast text is readable
Step 5: Confirm toast includes icon (success, error, info)
